**Primary Purpose**: ANSI terminal color formatting utility for Pygments syntax highlighter. Provides escape code mappings and text colorization functions for console output.

**Key Components**:

- **esc** (L11): Base ANSI escape sequence "\x1b[" used as prefix for all color codes
- **codes** dictionary (L13-37): Maps color/style names to ANSI escape sequences
  - Reset code (L15): "reset" â†’ "\x1b[39;49;00m" 
  - Text styles (L17-22): bold, faint, standout, underline, blink, overline
  - Dynamic color generation (L29-33): Builds 16 color mappings from dark_colors and light_colors arrays
  - Color override (L37): "white" mapped to bold instead of standard white

**Public Functions**:
- **reset_color()** (L40-41): Returns reset escape sequence to clear formatting
- **colorize(color_key, text)** (L44-45): Wraps text with specified color and auto-reset
- **ansiformat(attr, text)** (L48-70): Advanced formatter supporting attribute combinators:
  - `+color+`: blinking (L58-60)
  - `*color*`: bold (L61-63) 
  - `_color_`: underlined (L64-66)
  - Multiple attributes can be combined on same color

**Architecture Notes**:
- Color codes follow standard ANSI terminal specifications (30-37 for dark, 90-97 for bright)
- Stateless design - each function returns complete formatting strings
- Cleanup pattern (L35): Removes temporary loop variables to avoid namespace pollution
- Color aliasing: "white" treated as bold rather than standard terminal white

**Dependencies**: None - pure Python standard library

**Critical Constraints**:
- Requires ANSI-compatible terminal for proper display
- Color keys must exist in codes dictionary or will raise KeyError
- Reset codes automatically appended to prevent formatting bleed
